articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Palestinian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Palestinian President

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority who is president of Palestine and chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, on the day of international solidarity with the Palestinian people.
					
					 Kim in the message reaffirmed the DPRK's consistent support and solidarity with the Palestinian people in the just cause to retake their self-determination and Palestine's rights and the legitimate national rights to found an independent state with Kuds as its capital, and wished him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Inspects State Academy of Sciences
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Inspects State Academy of Sciences

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim made field survey of the State Academy of Sciences on Sunday.
					
					 After looking round various places of the academy, he held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting made a discussion on the need for scientists and technicians to live up to trust and expectations of the Workers' Party of Korea by making tangible contributions to the improvement of the people's living standard with achievements based on the latest science and technology, the need for relevant units to preferentially provide conditions necessary for scientific research and other issues.
					
					 Earlier Choe acquainted himself with management and operation of the Pyongyang Textile Mill and Pyongyang Circus Theater and took relevant measures.

articles.title: DPRK Delegate on Marine Security and Environment
articles.content:
DPRK Delegate on Marine Security and Environment Protection

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will positively contribute to the international efforts for marine security and environmental protection.
					
					 The head of the DPRK delegation declared this stand, speaking at the 27th convention of the International Maritime Organization on November 22.
					
					 The present reality, in which global trade is to still rely on the traditional marine transport, calls for enhanced responsibility and role of the IMO supporting it, he said.
					
					 Noting that the DPRK government is concentrating all efforts on the economic construction with main stress put on radically improving the standard of people's living, he said:
					
					 Accordingly, big efforts have been directed to the work for development of the nation's marine transport.
					
					 Through preparations under the voluntary inspection system of IMO member nations in particular, a series of achievements were made in implementing main convention and rules adopted by the IMO.
					
					 Related domestic laws and regulations were revised to smoothly implement the convention and rules and their amendments recently adopted and effectuated by IMO, and the Korean Maritime Authentication Centre was set up to further improve the quality control system of the marine administration.
					
					 The Marine Search and Rescue Coordination Centre, equipped with standard equipment meeting the requirements under the IMO convention, has begun regular operation and a national marine search and rescue system was established to rapidly respond to SOS from ships.
					
					 In recent years the Korean Maritime Environment Fund was organized to further strengthen the national system for emergency measure on ship oil spill and measures were provided to take instant and effective response in this field.
					
					 The DPRK government will as ever boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the IMO member states in the consistent idea of external policy--independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: DPRK, Cuba Ink Inter-governmental Protocols
articles.content:
DPRK, Cuba Ink Inter-governmental Protocols

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A protocol on the meeting for economic, scientific and technological cooperation and development in 2012 and a protocol on the commodity exchange in 2012 were signed between the DPRK and Cuba governments in Havana on November 24. 
					
					 The protocols were separately inked by DPRK Ambassador to Cuba Kwon Sung Chol and First Vice-Minister of Trade and Foreign Investment of Cuba Orlando Hernandez.

articles.title: New DPRK Ambassador to Cambodia Appointed
articles.content:
New DPRK Ambassador to Cambodia Appointed

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Hong Ki Chol was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Cambodia, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: DPRK Delegations Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegations Back Home

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Peace Committee of Korea led by Vice-Chairman Kim Jin Bom and a delegation of Rodong Sinmun led by its Deputy Editor Choe Kap Song returned home on Sunday after winding up their visit to China.

articles.title: Exhibition of Inventions on Athletic Apparatus Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Inventions on Athletic Apparatus Held

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The 15th National Exhibition of Inventions on Athletic Apparatus took place in Pyongyang.
					
					 On display there were inventions of 290 odd kinds presented by many units across the country, including industrial establishments and scientific and educational institutions in the field of physical culture and sports groups. Among them were such training apparatuses as athletic equipment and measuring devices.
					
					 The exhibition well showed the achievements made in the production of sporting equipment and goods.

articles.title: Book on Greatness of Kim Jong Il Published
articles.content:
Book on Greatness of Kim Jong Il Published

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Vol. 3 "Great Master of Leadership Art" of book "Comrade Kim Jong Il, Legendary Great Person" has been brought out in the DPRK.
					
					 This volume consisting of four chapters deals with the great leadership art of Kim Jong Il who has guided the party, state, army and people along the road of victory and glory in the historic period from the latter half of the 20th century up to now.
					
					 Chapter 1 "Great Master of Theory on Leadership Art" tells about the ideo-theoretical feats of Kim Jong Il who provided the general principles of Juche-based leadership art reflecting the demand of the times and the developing revolution, which will remain forever with the century.
					
					 Chapter 2 "Great Man Who Opened up New Path for Establishing Revolutionary Leadership System" contains historical data on the facts that he has led the army and people of the DPRK to victory with his extraordinary leadership ability.
					
					 Chapter 3 "Statesman Leading Revolution and Construction with Distinguished Method" tells about the greatness of Kim Jong Il who has applied the revolutionary working method of Juche on the highest level, bringing about great epoch-making changes.
					
					 Chapter 4 "Leader Guiding Masses with Noble Popular Style of Work" tells about the greatness of Kim Jong Il who leads the Korean army and people to victory, showing warm care for them with his noble traits and great devotion.

articles.title: Serious Case Owes His Life to Socialist Society
articles.content:
Serious Case Owes His Life to Socialist Society

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The North Hamgyong Provincial People's Hospital saved a patient from a critical condition some time ago.
					
					 The patient, who had suffered a third-degree burn in 70 percent of his body, returned to life thanks to utmost sincerity of medical workers and Chongjin citizens.
					
					 The patient is a worker of the Komusan Cement Factory.
					
					The hospital held scores of consultative meetings to take proper measures to save him.  
					
					 During more than ten skin transplantations, not only workers of the cement factory but teachers and students of Chongjin Medical University, Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy and other educational institutions in Chongjin donated their blood and skin pieces.
					
					 Most of the donors were strangers to the patient, but they did laudable deeds, regarding him as their revolutionary comrade. 
					
					Witnessing their sincerity and her son's recovery, the mother of the patient said, "I am really grateful to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for guiding our socialist society based on love for human beings."

articles.title: Choe Ho Song, Engineer at Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Choe Ho Song, Engineer at Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Choe Ho Song, 60, has worked at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex for more than 30 years after graduating from Hamhung University of Hydraulic Engineering.
					
					 Now he is an engineer of the hot-rolling shop at the complex.
					
					 He has greatly contributed to putting the nation's metal industry on the Juche basis by making nearly 60 technological innovations and inventions, including the introduction of high-temperature air combustion technology in hot-rolling process. 
					
					 He renewed the fuel supplying system for heating furnace to sharply reduce its starting time and increase its serviceable life and production capacity.
					
					 The technology of depositing iron cast roll developed by him is of great importance in metallurgical industry.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who visited the complex in April this year, saw the operation of the high-temperature air combustion heating furnace and expressed great satisfaction over the new method of steel production based on fuel available in the country, not heavy oil.
					
					 He appreciated Choe Ho Song as a patriotic-minded technician for his contribution to developing the nation's metal industry and for his training of many technicians and skilled workers.

articles.title: Kim Sat Gat, Epigrammatist of Ri Dynasty
articles.content:
Kim Sat Gat, Epigrammatist of Ri Dynasty

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Sat Gat (1807-1863) was a celebrated epigrammatist of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 His original name was Kim Pyong Yon but he was called Kim Sat Gat as he always put on a conical bamboo rain-hat. Sat Gat means conical bamboo rain-hat.
					
					 Kim, famous for his poetic talent in his childhood, had toured all areas of the country from the age of 21, ridiculing ignorance and stupidity of the feudal rulers and aristocrats and the foul features of society with his keen and nimble poetic language.
					
					 His poems also reflect the miserable life of the working people and beautiful landscape of the country.
					
					 His tour continued for nearly four decades. 
					
					 His satiric poems, which enjoyed great popularity among local people, are conspicuous in the Korean nation's history of medieval literature.
					
					 Some of his poems are contained in "Kim Sat Gat's Poem Collection" and "Epigrammatist Kim Sat Gat".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts US Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts US Hostile Policy toward DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is bound to misfire as was proven by the history of the U.S.-DPRK hostile relations.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 It is because the DPRK is the biggest, dignified and invincible power which can neither be pulled down nor broken apart.
					
					 The Korean people could frustrate every desperate move of the U.S. aimed to stifle the DPRK as they have Kim Jong Il in the van of the revolution.
					
					 His Songun revolutionary leadership, the Songun politics serve as the source of tremendous power, treasured sword and decisive guarantee for victory.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK are united close around the party and the leader, firmly determined to devotedly defend their country and socialist system and honorably safeguard the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation. This single-minded unity has become the main factor for resolutely frustrating any enemy moves and helped cement the DPRK's might to the maximum.
					
					 Strongest of all its might is the political and ideological might of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The might of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are clearly proven in their military and technological aspect. They have diverse war tactics and strategies capable of fighting any battles and aggression wars and their soldiers are physically well prepared. They also have offensive and defensive means including the deterrent for self-defense capable of mounting merciless strikes. This is the military and technological characteristics of the KPA.
					
					 Under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il the Juche-based national defence industry has been bolstered, equipping the KPA with modern military hardware for making annihilating attacks on enemies and helping it lay a solid material and technological foundation for fighting modern and protracted wars.
					
					 If anyone dares provoke the DPRK, the KPA will obliterate the aggressors wherever they might be.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to understand its rival and drop the anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK. To do so is the right step and would be beneficial for the U.S.

articles.title: Political Suppression Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Political Suppression Denounced in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification released a commentary on Friday urging the authorities to immediately stop the politically-motivated suppression. 
					
					 The Intelligence Service, police and prosecution searched houses of former members of the Headquarters under the pretence of intensifying investigation into a "spy-ring case" and charged them with violation of the "National Security Law", the commentary said, adding: This is a foolish attempt to create a terror-ridden atmosphere in society by escalating political suppression of the progressive organizations. 
					
					 With any use of dictatorial power the authorities can never repress the growing struggle against the traitors who sold off south Korea as a whole.

articles.title: S. Korea Tops List of World's Children Traffickers
articles.content:
S. Korea Tops List of World's Children Traffickers

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The present south Korean authorities topped the list of those which sold children to the United States. 
					
					 Half of the children smuggled to the U.S. last year were from south Korea, according to the recent survey by the U.S. Department of State. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities have made profits by selling a great number of children to other countries every year. 
					
					 This is one of examples that show the miserable plight of south Korean children under the group of traitors' unpopular rule. 
					
					 The smuggling of children is an intolerable crime.

articles.title: Significant Day of DPRK Observed in Nepal and Mexico
articles.content:
Significant Day of DPRK Observed in Nepal and Mexico

					Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The Nepali and Mexican newspapers carried special write-ups to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The Nepali newspaper Charcha on November 21 carried an article titled "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, 1991-2011" with his photo.
					
					 His 20-year long history as supreme commander of the KPA is shining in history, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il has put the defence capacity of the country on the highest stage.
					
					 He saw to it that the modernization of the national defence industry was pushed forward in reliance on its own strength, technology and raw materials.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has successfully defended socialism.
					
					 He published several works in which he clarified the law governing socialist construction, its historical inevitability and fundamental ways for the victory of socialism, putting it on the new scientific basis.
					
					 He frustrated the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle socialism.
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Il ushered in the new era of building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation, the paper introduced achievements performed by the Korean people in building an economic power under his leadership.
					
					 The Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional on November 15 carried an article "The Supreme Commander and Soldier Family" with a photo of Kim Jong Il inspecting a KPA unit.

articles.title: Russian Radio Blames S. Korean Military Exercises
articles.content:
Russian Radio Blames S. Korean Military Exercises

					 Tehran, November 27 (KCNA) -- Iran is paying deep attention to the work to increase the national defense capacity.
					
					 A high-ranking officer of the anti-air raid armed forces of the country recently said that Iranian experts have completed the design of the latest anti-air raid missile defense system with its own technology.
					
					 It is said that this system will be soon deployed on the anti-air raid network.

articles.title: Rural Road Construction in China
articles.content:
Rural Road Construction in China

					Beijing, November 27 (KCNA) -- Zhejiang Province, China has planned to construct and reconstruct 9,000 kilometers of rural roads during the period of the 12th Five Year Plan.
					
					 It is reported that when completed, road will extend more than one hundred thousand kilometers.

articles.title: Development of Minor Enterprises Urged in China
articles.content:
Development of Minor Enterprises Urged in China

					 Beijing, November 27 (KCNA) -- A vice-premier of the Chinese State Council called for putting small and medium enterprises on a high level.
					
					 Speaking at a meeting held in Nantong City, Jiangsu Province, on Nov. 22, Zhang Dejiang said to develop small-to-medium-sized enterprises extensively is a long-term strategic task of China.
					
					 It is important to comprehensively implement policies and measures of the C.C., the Communist Party and the State Council to promote the development of minor enterprises on the basis of the view of scientific development, Zhang said. 
					
					 It is also important to help smaller enterprises overcome difficulties and develop in a healthy way, the vice-premier added.

articles.title: Transport Security Should Be Ensured; Russian PM
articles.content:
Transport Security Should Be Ensured; Russian PM

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin called for ensuring transport security in the country. 
					
					 Addressing a recent meeting of the Standing Committee of the Government, Putin said up-to-date security standards should be applied to the overall transport field.
					
					 To this end, it is essential to educate and reeducate transport personnel and evaluate their work on a regular basis, while establishing order in organizational work and management, he added.

articles.title: Russia Develops New Combat Equipment to Counter MD: Expert
articles.content:
Russia Develops New Combat Equipment to Counter MD: Expert

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- A Russian military expert recently said the country is developing combat equipment to counter the worldwide missile defense system (MD) sought by the United States.   
					
					 Victor Yesin said Russia's inter-continental ballistic missiles will be capable of hitting any target and that any promising missile defense system will not be able to intercept them.     
					
					 The new equipment will be applied not only to new missile complexes but to existing ones, the expert added.

articles.title: Russia to Develop Defense Industry
articles.content:
Russia to Develop Defense Industry

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- Sergei Ivanov, deputy prime minister of Russia, said the federal government adopted important decisions to develop the country's defense industry.
					
					 Speaking at a consultative meeting held at a machine factory recently, he said a federal plan is also being worked out for the reform of the defense industrial complex which needs much fund.
					
					 The plan is aimed to support the national program "Military Equipment" to be implemented by 2020, he added.

articles.title: Russia Sets Presidential Election Day
articles.content:
Russia Sets Presidential Election Day

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Russian Federation Council Friday decided to have a presidential election on March 4, 2012. 
					
					  All members of the council approved the decision at its general session, a local media report said.

articles.title: Vladimir Putin Nominated as Candidate for Presidency of Russia
articles.content:
Vladimir Putin Nominated as Candidate for Presidency of Russia

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- The "United Russia" Party officially decided to put up Prime Minister Vladimir Putin as its candidate for the presidential election of Russia to be held on March 4 next year.
					
					 The decision was adopted with support of all delegates at the Party's congress on November 27.

articles.title: Russian FM Expresses Concern over US Plan
articles.content:
Russian FM Expresses Concern over US Plan

					 Moscow, November 27 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov recently expressed concern over the U.S. contradictory plan.
					
					 The U.S. is planning to build military bases in Afghanistan after the U.S. forces are withdrawn from it in 2014. In this regard he said that there are many contradictory points here.
					
					 The building of U.S. military bases in Afghanistan is related with the interests of the regional countries, he noted.
					
					 It is important to make clear the tasks of the military bases after the U.S. forces' withdrawal from Afghanistan, he said, demanding the U.S. explain about this.

articles.title: Radioactive Strontium Found in Downtown Tokyo
articles.content:
Radioactive Strontium Found in Downtown Tokyo

					Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Radioactive strontium, one of the substances closely monitored by the government around the Fukushima Daiichi atomic plant, has been detected in soil samples taken at three locations in downtown Tokyo, a citizens' group said Thursday, after finding the same element last month in Yokoyama.
					
					Soil collected from outside the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, Tokyo International Forum, both in Chiyoda Ward, and the Kiyosumi-Shirakawa subway station in Koto Ward measured 48, 51 and 44 becquerels per kilogram, respectively, it said, against 10 to 20 becquerels per kg seen prior to the Fukushima nuclear crisis at various places in Japan.

articles.title: Many Jordanians Demonstrate against Israel
articles.content:
Many Jordanians Demonstrate against Israel

					Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- More than 10,000 Jordanians on Friday demonstrated against Israel near the Jordanian-Israeli borders.
					
					They condemned Israel for its moves to make Kuds Zionist and called on the Israeli authorities to lift its siege imposed on Gaza.

articles.title: Anti-Israeli Rally Held in Gaza
articles.content:
Anti-Israeli Rally Held in Gaza

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Thousands of Palestinians rallied on Friday all over the Gaza Strip in protest to the Israeli measures to change the characteristics of East Kuds.
					
					 Israel is committing atrocities such as destroying the temporary woody bridge near the Mughrabi Gate and building a new bridge in order to make Kuds Zionist, they charged.
					
					 Kuds is an Arab city and will remain so, they noted, calling on the Muslim countries to take immediate measures to check the move of Israel.

articles.title: Algeria Rejects US, Western's Moves against Iran
articles.content:
Algeria Rejects US, Western's Moves against Iran

					 Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Abdelaziz Belkhadem, Special Representative of Algerian President in an interview with Iran's news agency on Wednesday clarified the stand of the country rejecting the U.S. and Western countries threatening Iran.
					
					 He told IRNA that the United Nations specialized agency must not be influenced by the United States and the other nuclear weapons states to challenge Iran's peaceful nuclear program. 
					
					 He said that any threat will not create obstacles for the member nation's national nuclear program.
					
					  He derided Tel Aviv regime for making hue and cry over Iranian nuclear program while it possesses stockpiles of nuclear arms which jeopardize peace and security in the Middle East.

articles.title: IRGC Commander: US Will Not Dare to Attack Iran
articles.content:
IRGC Commander: U.S. Will Not Dare to Attack Iran

					 Tehran, November 27 (KCNA) -- Commander of the IRGC Ground Force Brigadier-General Mohammad Pakpour in an interview with a news agency on Nov. 24 denounced the enemies for their propaganda campaign against Iran.
					
					 He said enemies' media propaganda and rumors on attacking Iran are a kind of bluff to mislead world public opinion.
					
					 The U.S. administration can not even think of any assault on Iran because it will face a crushing response by the committed Iranians, he noted.

articles.title: Iran to Develop Latest Anti-Air Raid Missile Defense System
articles.content:
Iran to Develop Latest Anti-Air Raid Missile Defense System

					 Tehran, November 27 (KCNA) -- Iran is paying deep attention to the work to increase the national defense capacity.
					
					 A high-ranking officer of the anti-air raid armed forces of the country recently said that Iranian experts have completed the design of the latest anti-air raid missile defense system with its own technology.
					
					 It is said that this system will be soon deployed on the anti-air raid network.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige el distrito de Kwail
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige el distrito de Kwail

					Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el distrito de Kwail de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Primeramente, recorrio el museo de la historia revolucionaria y la sala de representacion del historial del distrito.
					
					En el museo estan exhibidos los valiosos datos historicos que muestran las inmortales hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien convirtio dicho distrito en gran campo frutal de talla mundial y la orgullosa trayectoria de desarrollo que ha registrado la historia de gran transformacion bajo la sabia direccion del partido.
					
					Kim Jong Il expreso profunda emocion mirando uno tras otro los datos historicos exhibidos en el museo.
					
					Al enterarse de los datos historicos de que al cabo de ver el mapa en el periodo de la guerra de liberacion de la patria el Presidente dijo que esta zona es la tierra apropiada para arboles frutales y envio cientos de miles de posturas de arboles frutales con lo cual se inicio la nueva historia del distrito de Kwail, recordo cordialmente la abnegacion e ingentes esfuerzos del Presidente para el desarrollo del distrito.
					
					En la sala de representacion del historial vio con atencion los datos de exito logrados por el distrito en el pasado bajo la direccion del partido.
					
					Acto seguido, dando vueltas por varios lugares del distrito se entero en detalles del estado de modernizacion y la produccion de frutas.
					
					Al mirar el campo frutal infinitamente extendido, evaluo a los miembros del partido y los trabajadores del distrito quienes trabajaron mucho en pleno acato a la politica de fruticultura del partido.
					
					Al recorrer el instituto de fruticultura se entero del estado de investigacion de fruticultura y presento las tareas y medios que se presentan ante el instituto.
					
					Cerciorandose del estado de cultivo de sauce de nueva variedad capaz de hacer gran aporte a fabricar los continentes de produccion de frutos incluidas las cestas y de resolver el problema de lena de los habitantes distritales.
					
					El Dirigente presento las tareas que le incumben al distrito.
					
					Senalo que dicho distrito tiene favorables condiciones naturales tanto en la altura sobre el nivel del mar como la insolacion, la temperatura acumulada y el estado de tierra para el desarrollo de fruticultura.
					
					Subrayo que para desarrollar trascendentalmente la fruticultura conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo hay que librar energicamente la lucha por elevar a nivel alto la cientifizacion, la modernizacion y la intensificacion de la produccion de frutas.
					
					Indico que para ese efecto hay que cultivar en gran escala los manzanos de talla baja e introducir activamente las buenas variedades.
					
					Enfatizo que para hacer de modo cientifico y tecnico el abonamiento y cultivo de arboles frutales, elevar el rendimiento de cosecha por hectarea e introducir activamente la tecnologia avanzada es importante elevar la funcion y el papel de las unidades correspondientes incluso el instituto de fruticultura.
					
					Destaco que se debe organizar bien la labor para activar la produccion de la base de elaboracion de frutas.
					
					Le acompanaron Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Kim Kyong Ok y Han Kwang Sang, primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, y los generales de ejercito del EPC Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong y Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: RPDC hara esfuerzos por seguridad y ambiente maritimos
articles.content:
RPDC hara esfuerzos por seguridad y ambiente maritimos

					Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea contribuira activamente a los esfuerzos internacionales por la seguridad maritima y la proteccion del ambiente maritimo, dijo el jefe de la delegacion de la RPDC en su discurso pronunciado el dia 22 en el 27o congreso de la Organizacion Maritima Internacional. 
					
					La realidad de hoy en que el comercio mundial depende tradicionalmente del transporte maritimo demanda fortalecer la responsabilidad y el papel de la OMI, dijo. 
					
					El gobierno de la RPDC concentra todas las fuerzas en la construccion economica enfocando a elevar decisivamente la vida del pueblo, y para ese fin, presta atencion al desarrollo del transporte maritimo del pais, destaco. 
					
					 En particular, a traves de los preparativos bajo el sistema de inspeccion voluntaria de paises miembros de la OMI, ha alcanzado algunos exitos en el cumplimiento de los convenios y reglamentos principales aprobados por la OMI. 
					
					  Ha modificado los reglamentos nacionales correspondientes para cumplir satisfactoriamente los convenios, reglamentos y documentos revisados, que fueron aprobados y estan en vigor por la OMI, y ha instituido el Centro de Autenticacion Maritima de Corea, de modo que se mejorara el sistema de control cualitativo de la administracion maritima. 
					
					Entro en gestion normal el centro de coordinacion de socorro y de la investigacion maritima dispuesto de las instalaciones estandares convenientes a las exigencias del convenio de la OMI y se ha establecido el sistema estatal de investigacion maritima y socorro capaz de responder rapido a SOS de los barcos. 
					
					Para fortalecer mas el sistema estatal por las medidas emergentes sobre el derrame de aceite de barcos, organizo la Fundacion de Proteccion de Ambiente Maritimo de Corea y tomo otras medidas inminentes y efectivas. 
					
					Tambien en el futuro, el gobierno de la RPDC fortalecera las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con los paises miembros de la OMI bajo el ideal de su invariable politica exterior: la independencia, la paz y la amistad, concluyo.

articles.title: Rubricados protocolos entre Corea y Cuba
articles.content:
Rubricados protocolos entre Corea y Cuba

					Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedaron rubricados el dia 24 en La Habana, Cuba, el protocolo de la reunion para el desarrollo de la colaboracion economica y cientifico-tecnica para el ano 2012 y el otro sobre el intercambio comercial para 2012, entre el gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el de la Republica de Cuba. 
					
					El embajador coreano en Cuba, Kwon Sung Chol, y el primer viceministro del Comercio Exterior y la Inversion Extranjera de Cuba, Orlando Hernandez Guillen, firmaron los documentos.

articles.title: Nombrado embajador coreano en Camboya
articles.content:
Nombrado embajador coreano en Camboya

					Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Hong Ki Chol fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en el Reino de Camboya.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela intento de difamacion de EE.UU. sobre Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela intento de difamacion de EE.UU. sobre Corea

					Pyongyang, 28 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el candidato al secretario adjunto del Departamento de Defensa de Estados Unidos, en la audiencia del personal del Comite de Servicio Militar de Senado, dijo que los misiles y el "plan de armas de exterminio masivo" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea son la grave y directa amenaza a los paises aliados de la region y el territorio estadounidense y esta "participa en la proliferacion de armas de exterminio masivo". Otros interesados del mismo departamento lanzan  tambien  la misma palabra.
					
					Las autoridades de la capa militar de EE.UU. recurren a difamacion y artimana contra la RPDC, lo cual muestra que el imperio es el autor de la destruccion de la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el mundo.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido el dia 27 y continua:
					
					Su intento es justificar la agresiva politica hostil anti-RPDC tildandola como "amenaza" a los paises aliados de la region y el territorio norteamericano y racionalizar sus maquinaciones de aumento de fuerzas armadas en la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					No es casual que EE.UU. se entrega con frenesi al alboroto de calumnia y la difamacion contra la RPDC con la falsedad y engano.
					
					Esto es los esfuerzos desesperados de los  atemorizados por la elevacion extraordinaria del prestigio internacional de la RPDC y  por el cada vez mas  agudo  aislamiento internacional de EE.UU. 
					
					Aunque las fuerzas belicas norteamericanas actuan freneticamente para amenazar y rendir a la RPDC sus maquinaciones se hallan en el destino del fracaso.
					
					Con cualesquier chismes, EE.UU. no puede deshonrar el alto prestigio exterior de la RPDC ni amedrentar al pueblo coreano.
